name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment in this case is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Hargest in the preceding case, No. 20, May Term, 1935.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: PMlip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margioiti, Attorney General, for appellant.
George Boss Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MaeCoy, Brittain, Evans <& Lewis and Morgan, Lewis <& Boelcius, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia
(No. 2).
June 29, 1935:
PMlip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margioiti, Attorney General, for appellant.
George Boss Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MaeCoy, Brittain, Evans <& Lewis and Morgan, Lewis <& Boelcius, for appellee.
